page.title: 07Changing Times in Northfleet
page.content: In 1900 the land around our school, Northfleet School for Girls,was mainly open fields and orchards.Since then many changes have taken place. Shopping centres,flats,housing estates and schools have been built.Many shops used to be houses.Large buildings have replaced fields and countryside.The doctor's surgery in Old Perry Street was a forge and the A2 was built where the Roman road Watling Street used to be.The school adjacent to ours, Northfleet Grammar, is in a building called Wombwell Hall.This house,and the surrounding countryside,were owned by Colyer Ferguson,who also owned a deer park because he liked wild animals.Old people in the area whom we spoke to felt that in the 1940s there was less noise and rush and people were more polite.Now there is litter, high prices,traffic and vandalism.
